intro: Gerbera tomentosa var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly gerbera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, fuzzy foliage and showy daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It prefers well-draining soil and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. The flowers bloom from spring to autumn, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
